item.title: a. humans-of-new-york
item.description: He makes me want to know about little things, so that I can teach him. Like when we sit by this lake, I wish I knew what kind of turtle that was, so I could tell him. And I want to finger out what kind of duck that is, so I can tell him about it next time we come. What do you want most for him? Whatever his dreams are, I’m down to ride for him.

item.title: a. Let Him Go, Olivia
item.description: There I was. Upside down inside the swimming pool. Drowned. My parents were screaming. It must have been the summer of ‘63. It was a gloomy day. Every Sunday we went to my grandparents’ house. My cousins and I were playing alongside the pool. I must have slipped. At three years old, I did not know how to swim. My mother was giving me CPR. More than twenty or twenty-five minutes had gone by.

item.title: a. Reading to Learn the Art of Expression
item.description: 课文 When you read a short story, you may read it merely for pleasure. When you read a biographical sketch, you may read it merely for information. But as you are a learner of English, I think you should often read to learn the art of expression. And for this purpose you may read either a short story or a biographical sketch, either an essay or a news item, indeed, anything that is written in good current English.

item.title: z. 形容词 `then` 用法详解
item.description: 核心概念 这里的 then 不是副词“然后”，而是形容词“当时的”。 原句分析 原短语： then recently discovered CPR 字面意思： “在当时那个时间点，新近被发现的心肺复苏术” 结构： then（形容词） + recently discovered（复合形容词） + CPR（名词） 语法功能 时间锚定作用 then 将“新发现”的时间锁定在故事发生的过去时刻，而不是作者写作的现在时刻。 双重时间限定 recently discovered：相对于某个时间点“最近” then：明确指出这个时间点是故事中的1963年 拆解理解 Without then: 新近发现的CPR（可能指现在的新发现） With then: 在当时（1963年） 算是新近发现的CPR 同义转换 …utilizing CPR, which was, at that time, a recently discovered technique.

item.title: z2 长难句解析
item.description: And also in recognition of editors who made it possible for my mother to have read in Reader’s Digest the miracle made by another woman utilizing then recently discovered CPR. 如何断句断句（“翻译 + 结构图”） 意思： 这句话在表达—— “同时也为了表彰那些编辑，是他们让我的母亲能够在《读者文摘》上读到另一位女性使用当时新发现的心肺复苏术创造的奇迹。” 结构图： in recognition of editors who made it possible for my mother to have read in Reader’s Digest the miracle made by another woman utilizing then recently discovered CPR 为什么 in Reader’s Digest 必须放在 have read 后面？ I found this sentence in a book, but I find it a bit difficult to break it into meaningful chunks while reading.

item.title: z3. in recognition of sb/sth
item.description: “In recognition of my teachers” 在句子中属于“状语”（Adverbial），具体来说是“状语中的目的状语”或“原因状语”。 1. 在新概念六部分分析法中的位置 你提到的 Subject（主语）, Verb（动词）, Object（宾语）, How（方式）, Where（地点）, When（时间） 是一个非常好的基础句型分析框架。但这个框架主要覆盖核心成分和最常见的状语。 “In recognition of…” 这个短语，不属于主语、动词或宾语这些核心成分。它是一个 额外的、补充说明性的成分，我们可以把它理解为 “Why”（原因）或 “For what purpose”（目的）。 虽然“How, Where, When”是常见的状语类别，但状语家族很庞大，还包括： 原因状语 (Adverbial of Reason) - Why? 目的状语 (Adverbial of Purpose) - For what purpose? 条件状语 (Adverbial of Condition) - Under what condition? 让步状语 (Adverbial of Concession) - Despite what?
